intro: Hieracium myriochaetum, commonly known as the many-bristled hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are deeply lobed and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hieracium myriochaetum is often found in open habitats and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
